data.event: The land was first sighted by Europeans in 1791, when Spanish explorer Lieutenant Francisco de Eliza mistook the area for an island and named it "Isla Capeda".
The first European settler in Delta was James Kennedy who pre-empted 135 acres in what later became Annieville in February 1860.
Thomas and William Ladner, began farming the area named after them in 1868.

event.title: grow quickly over the next few decades

data.event: Farming and fishing helped the community grow quickly over the next few decades.
In 1879, the area was incorporated to become "Delta", and the village of Ladner was made as its administrative centre.
